front.title: The Subnetwork Encapsulation and Adaptation Layer (SEAL)

abstract.t: Subnetworks are connected network regions bounded by border nodes that forward unicast and multicast packets over a virtual topology, often manifested by encapsulation and/or tunneling. This virtual topology may span multiple IP- and/or sub-IP layer forwarding hops, and can introduce failure modes due to packet duplication and/or links with diverse Maximum Transmission Units (MTUs). This document specifies a Subnetwork Encapsulation and Adaptation Layer (SEAL) that accommodates such virtual topologies over diverse underlying link technologies.
